name: nytimes
text:
RT @Jan_Ransom: LATEST: 4 of 5 district attorneys in #NewYorkCity refused to prosecute #GeorgeFloyd protesters arrested for minor offenses, the latest in a longer-running trend to not prosecute low-level crimes like marijuana, farebeating which targeted minorities: 

https://t.co/meEgrkwqKL

name: nytimes
text: Six eBay employees mounted a cyberstalking campaign against a couple who ran an online e-commerce newsletter, according to charges filed by federal prosecutors https://t.co/istRGsHri6

name: nytimes
text: Breaking News: Vice President Mike Pence encouraged governors to repeat a misleading claim about coronavirus outbreaks https://t.co/vEU5iJeXuY

name: nytimes
text: RT @cliffordlevy: New: The family of Tessa Majors criticized the sentence for the 14-year-old involved in the mugging that preceded her killing.  https://t.co/7xVDum1mHy

name: nytimes
text:
RT @NickAtNews: We dove deep into Cup Foods, the deli where the police killed George Floyd.

We learned that in the '90s, the Minneapolis Police Department surveilled the store, conducted undercover drug buys nearby and urged employees to call 911 on loiterers. 
https://t.co/PS27tswbUO

name: nytimes
text: House Democrats opened an investigation on Monday into the distribution of more than $500 billion in small-business loans under a pandemic relief program https://t.co/ztvMtPx0SY

name: nytimes
text: RT @nytgraphics: In the print edition of Tuesday’s NYTimes: an 8-page special section on the Black Lives Matter protests that have swept across the country, with photos from all 50 states and a 2-page map and table showing 2,000+ locations where protests were held. https://t.co/S9ljJYKzZqIn the print edition of Tuesday’s NYTimes: an 8-page special section on the Black Lives Matter protests that have s… https://t.co/1cRRrklUDT

name: nytimes
text: Neil Jacobs, NOAA’s acting administrator, “engaged in the misconduct intentionally, knowingly, or in reckless disregard” for the agency’s scientific integrity policy, according to a panel that investigated complaints against him https://t.co/7x5F8qsr72

name: nytimes
text:
RT @nytimesbooks: We asked two prominent American poets to write original poems responding to our present moment. 

This piece, by Claudia Rankine, is on our cover this week. (1/2) 
https://t.co/oo5cRvFHtL

name: nytimes
text: RT @ewong: The two top directors of @VOANews — @abennett & @slsugawara — have resigned, following the GOP-led Senate confirmation of Michael Pack, a conservative filmmaker & Steve Bannon ally. Trump pushed him as head of agency overseeing VOA & global US media. https://t.co/BHYGWitkMN

name: nytimes
text: Starting June 15 and 16, a tentative welcome mat is being laid out for visitors in many European countries and a few Caribbean islands https://t.co/ZcTt18VDGz

name: nytimes
text: The man accused of a series of murders and rapes in California during the 1970s and ’80s — known as the “Golden State Killer” case — is expected to accept a plea deal that would allow him to avoid the death penalty, according to victims’ families https://t.co/DZ4F9iIAK2

name: nytimes
text: RT @NYTBen: Having mostly won Syria's civil war, Bashar al-Assad now faces an array of problems he can't bomb his way out of. https://t.co/By70gTRV6u

name: nytimes
text: Vice President Mike Pence encouraged governors to adopt the administration’s explanation that a rise in testing was a reason behind new coronavirus outbreaks, even though testing data has shown that such a claim is misleading https://t.co/dCXe2wG8Sk

name: nytimes
text:
RT @tminsberg: Brown would be shutting down their men's varsity running programs, an email announced. 

12 days later the decision was reversed. 

@alanblinder and I looked into the effort – one that rivals some campaigns for public office – that saved the programs:
https://t.co/CEfQOh9ci8

name: nytimes
text: RT @TylerKepner: On Baseball: As Baseball Teeters, Rob Manfred’s Words Ring Hollow https://t.co/mnHS5VjrwZ

name: nytimes
text: The authorities in Beijing placed a swath of the city under lockdown on Monday and tested tens of thousands of people as they rushed to contain a new coronavirus outbreak that marked an unnerving breach in China’s capital https://t.co/SQYLKdqxy6
